title: Spirit Children of Heavenly Parents
summary: Before this life, we lived as spirit sons and daughters of Heavenly Parents, learning, progressing, and forming eternal relationships.
scriptureText: "Before I formed thee in the belly I knew thee; and before thou camest forth out of the womb I sanctified thee..."
insight: Your existence began long before your birth. You were known, valued, and prepared for a unique purpose in God’s family. Your identity is rooted in eternity, not circumstance.

title: The Council in Heaven
summary: Heavenly Father presented His Plan of Happiness, choosing Jesus Christ as the Savior who would make our progression possible.
scriptureText: "We will go down, for there is space there, and we will take of these materials... and we will prove them herewith."
insight: Your life is not accidental—it's the result of a divine, thoughtful council. You agreed to come to earth knowing Christ would guide and redeem you. Your journey has purpose and eternal direction.

title: Agency and Choice
summary: In the premortal world, we chose to follow Heavenly Father and Jesus Christ, accepting a plan that required agency, risk, and growth.
scriptureText: "Satan sought to destroy the agency of man..."
insight: Agency is not just freedom—it is the foundation of your eternal growth. Every choice shapes who you become. Choosing Christ is the choice that brings lasting peace and progress.

title: Birth and a Physical Body
summary: Receiving a physical body begins our mortal experience—a time designed for growth, testing, joy, and learning things we could not learn in the spirit alone.
scriptureText: "This life is the time for men to prepare to meet God..."
insight: Mortality is a sacred classroom. Even its difficulties are tailored to transform you. Every challenge can become a step toward becoming more like the Savior.

title: Faith and Repentance
summary: Faith in Jesus Christ leads us to change, grow, and realign our lives with God through sincere repentance.
scriptureText: "We believe that through the Atonement of Christ, all mankind may be saved, by obedience to the laws and ordinances of the Gospel."
insight: Repentance is not a punishment—it is a gift. It is a daily invitation to return to Christ, refine your heart, and experience real spiritual renewal.

title: Covenants and Ordinances
summary: Through ordinances like baptism and confirmation, we enter into sacred, binding covenants that draw us closer to Jesus Christ and strengthen us with His power.
scriptureText: "He that believeth in me, and is baptized, the same shall be saved..."
insight: Covenants are not restrictions—they are spiritual partnerships with God. They unlock divine help, protection, and direction throughout your life.

title: The Atonement of Jesus Christ
summary: Through His infinite Atonement, Jesus Christ bore our sins, pains, sorrows, and weaknesses, making redemption and healing possible.
scriptureText: "He will take upon him the pains and the sicknesses of his people..."
insight: Christ not only understands your struggles—He has personally experienced them. His Atonement transforms suffering into strength, guilt into peace, and mortality into hope.

title: Life After Death
summary: After death, our spirits move to the spirit world—a place of continued learning, peace, and preparation for resurrection.
scriptureText: "The spirits of all men... are taken home to that God who gave them life."
insight: Death is not a disappearance—it is a return. You continue to learn, grow, and progress, surrounded by God’s love and the influence of the Savior.

title: Preaching the Gospel in the Spirit World
summary: Those who did not receive the gospel in mortality are taught in the spirit world, ensuring that all of God’s children receive a fair and loving opportunity.
scriptureText: "For for this cause was the gospel preached also to them that are dead..."
insight: God’s mercy is perfectly inclusive. No one is forgotten, overlooked, or denied the truth because of where or when they lived.

title: Spirit Paradise and Spirit Prison
summary: The spirit world includes conditions of peace or learning based on our choices. Through Christ, progression continues beyond the veil.
scriptureText: "He organized his forces and appointed messengers..."
insight: Christ’s ministry does not stop at death. His love penetrates every place—bringing hope, teaching, and redemption to all willing souls.

title: Resurrection
summary: Because of Christ’s victory over death, every person will rise with a perfected, immortal body.
scriptureText: "For as in Adam all die, even so in Christ shall all be made alive."
insight: Resurrection is a gift of pure grace—restoring what was lost, healing what was broken, and ensuring that death never has the final word.

title: Final Judgment
summary: We will stand before Jesus Christ, who will judge us with perfect justice, mercy, and complete understanding of our lives and desires.
scriptureText: "Our words will condemn us, yea, all our works will condemn us..."
insight: The judgment is not meant to shame—it is a moment of truth, healing, and clarity. Christ sees your intentions, your efforts, and your heart.

title: Celestial Kingdom
summary: The highest degree of glory is reserved for those who embrace Christ fully, keep their covenants, and endure faithfully to the end.
scriptureText: "They are they who received the testimony of Jesus..."
insight: The celestial kingdom is not simply a destination—it is the fulfillment of divine love: eternal families, limitless growth, and the presence of God forever.

title: Terrestrial Kingdom
summary: Those who lived honorable lives but did not fully accept the gospel in mortality receive terrestrial glory through God’s justice and mercy.
scriptureText: "These are they who are honorable men of the earth..."
insight: The terrestrial kingdom reveals God’s respect for agency. He honors sincerity, goodness, and righteousness—even when faith was incomplete.

title: Telestial Kingdom
summary: Those who repeatedly rejected the gospel in mortality but eventually accept Christ’s justice and mercy inherit telestial glory.
scriptureText: "These are they who are liars, and sorcerers..."
insight: Even the telestial kingdom shines with God’s goodness. It testifies that His mercy extends further than we can imagine—lifting every soul to a glory they are willing to receive.
